DOC.detailed_description: Objective : The proposal aim examine efficacy safety sinew acupuncture knee osteoarthritis ( KOA ) . Hypothesis test : Sinew acupuncture reduce pain intensity , improve knee function health-related quality life without significant side effect KOA subject compare sham acupuncture treatment . Design : A randomized , subject- assessor-blind , sham acupuncture-controlled clinical trial Participants : Subjects ( N=86 ) randomize sinew acupuncture sham acupuncture group ( 1:1 ratio ) . Study instrument : Visual Analog Scale ( VAS ) , Western Ontario McMasters University Osteoarthritis Index ( WOMAC ) , Timed & Go Test ( TUG ) , 8-step Stair Climb Test ( SCT ) assessment , Short Form-36 ( SF-36 ) . Intervention : Sinew acupuncture group receive 10 session needle 4 week . Sham group receive non-invasive treatment procedure . All subject follow 6 week . Main outcome measure : VAS knee pain intensity week 4 serf primary outcome . VAS time point , WOMAC score , TUG , SCT SF-36 analyze secondary outcome . Data analysis : Analysis 'intention treat ' principle . T-test mixed-effect model analysis use measure primary secondary outcome respectively . Expected result : Sinew acupuncture treatment significantly reduce knee pain intensity , improve knee function quality life without obvious side effect .
